name: Hilton St. Augustine Historic Bayfront

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing view could see St. Augusine bayfront well from the room. The bed slept well it had an incredibly soft down comforter/alternative. Room was very clean and definitely one of the nicest rooms I have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Wedding Night Stay

reviews.text: A tourist hotel that looks like it is straight out of northern Spain, in accordance with its founder Menendez de Aviles. Great location, across from San Marcos and convenient to the quaint shopping street. A pleasant change from other types of hotels.
reviews.title: Charming replica of Asturias

reviews.text: I stayed here on business and hope to return for pleasure. The hotel looks out on the bay, especially beautiful at sunrise and sunset. The hotel consists of the main building and several adjacent guest houses. I stayed in the main building and was treated to a very spacious, clean and comfortable room. Parking is underneath the main building, and appears to be only by valet. Everyone on staff was friendly, professional and efficient.
reviews.title: Charming Hilton in the heart of historic St. Augustine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From start to finish everything went smooth! Hotel is amazing! Everyone is so helpful and always smiling,makes you feel very comfortable during your stay! I would never recommend another place to stay ever! Very satisfied!
reviews.title: very satisfied

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Historic Bayfront Hilton is THE hotel to stay at if you wish to explore downtown St. Augustine. It is only a block from St. George Street and easy walking distance to all of the downtown attractions. The valet parking is perfect seeing how parking is a nightmare in the city. The hotel is very quaint looking, clean and well managed. There is a small dining area in the lobby but the food is fantastic. At check in we were provided an envelope that would hold a 10-100% discount on the food portion of your bill at the lobby restaurant and we got 100%! The food is a little pricey ($22-30/adult) but was very good. Don't get the cheesecake though, it was still frozen.
reviews.title: Perfect location and free food!
Comfortable, close and nice
reviews.text: We had a good experience at this hotel. It is set in an excellent location right by the water, fort, and old town. The buildings of the hotel fit well into the neighbourhood. The room decor was a bit dark and dated but clean and comfortable. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends and family visiting St Augustine.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I were only here for the night so we were not here very long but it was really nice. Everyone was very friendly and is is in a great location and you can walk almost anywhere in the city (except the lighthouse which is on the other side of the bridge). Would recommend anytime.
reviews.title: Quiet Get Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this hotel! During our stay here, the staff was wonderful, helpful, and so very polite. Our room was immaculate, the bed was comfortable, and we even were lucky to have a room with a view. You can't beat the location!! This hotel was within walking distance to everything in the historic district of St. Augustine. They let us check in early and check out late. It never hurts to ask!
reviews.title: St. Augustine Historic Bayfront

reviews.text: Very disappointing. Charged top dollar for tiny room offering nothing. View of the street on 1st floor. Had to keep curtains closed at all times because otherwise people on street could see right in. Bathroom floors polished to high shine- Looked great but VERY slippery when wet. Would not stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: weekend stay

reviews.text: Yep. The title says it all. I left Knoxville for my favorite city, St. Augustine, FL, to indulge in a luxurious weekend of fun in the sun. This hotel made the vacation worthwhile, because the staff were accommodating, the rooms were amazing, and the restaurant was delightful. This hotel is definite 5 star quality! I have already reserved a room for next time. Seeya next year Hilton!
reviews.title: Found some shoes and left Tennessee for luxury

reviews.text: We stayed at this property during Easter weekend. We were traveling with our 9 year old son. I usually like to stay at a Bed & Breakfast in St Augustine but because we were traveling with our son a Hotel was more appropriate. We love this property! Staff was very nice and accommodating. The location was the best. The back of the hotel gets you into the the heart of St Augustine. We couldn't ask for a better location. Will be back!
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton is well managed with pleasant greetings from the Valet Parking Attendant and Front Desk Staff. Having convenient parking in the historic district is a rare luxury in this town. The rooms were well appointed; turn down service was included. The views of the harbor from view rooms are wonderful and balconies pleasant for sitting. Staff are most accommodating. Some excellent restaurants are within easy walking distances as are the historic attractions. Customers should be aware,however, of the downside common to all places on the main street, considerable traffic noise during the day. At night it was not a significant problem during our stay.
reviews.title: Convenient Luxury Comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent room amenities, friendly staff, well situated for getting aout and about. Friendly staff. Comfortable beds with quality linens, and spotlessly clean. We ate breakfast at the buffet, it was mazing, the lunch was excellent. Soom room service snacks,again excellent. Can't say anything negative, overall perfect experience
reviews.title: Everything perfect!

reviews.text: this is one of the best hilton hotel out there. excellent service starts as you drive in. this will be the last time you need your car, you can walk to all of the historic district. do not skip the breakfast at the hotel it is one of the best out there.
reviews.title: excellent hotel in an excellent location

reviews.text: We arrived late in the afternoon, took a chance there were rooms, and was not disappointed. The staff is amazing and the location was perfect. The rooms were clean, the bathroom had all the amenities you could want. The furnishings were very comfortable and I slept very well, considering I wasn't at home.
reviews.title: Beautiful place, great people.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was one of the best I've ever booked! The staff was friendly, extremely professional. The room was clean, comfortable and we had a walk out door to the pool! We could see the bay and palm trees above the wall around the pool. The location was fantastic since we could walk anywhere in town. I can't say enough about this hotel and I highly recommend it to anyone going to St. Augustine!
reviews.title: Stay at the Hilton in St. Augustine!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location to downtown but don't expect a view if paying for a more expensive room and yes, we did ask for a "scenic view". Our bed sagged in the middle and we had a great view of a brick wall along a side alley:/ Spa was great, room was clean...once it was ready. Even though we did not have to wait but a few minutes after 3pm to check in, when you spend more money for a room like this it should be ready before less expensive rooms in our opinion. We didn't hate it but for being HH members the Garden Inn is a better value. No problems with the staff, cosmetically everything looked good. I would be open to try other options next time or the same place if only for less $.
reviews.title: Good location to downtown but don't expect a view if paying for a more expensive room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton in St. Augustine is a wonderful place to stay. We were in St. Augustine April 4-6. I do not remember our room number - but is was on the second floor. The location is perfect as we were able to pretty much walk to most of the venues we wished to visit. We were only there two nights and I certainly wish we had planned more. The staff was professional and more than willing to answer any questions we had. Check-in was quick and easy with everything all in order when we arrived. Everyone always had a smile and a friendly hello. When we return to St. Augustine we will certainly stay at the Hilton again. Our room was immaculate. It had a coffee pot with wonderful coffee. There was also a refrigerator. Our room had a Jacuzzi tub in it and although we never had a chance to use it, it certainly looked wonderful. We had a small balcony off our room that had a quaint view of one of the side streets and a side view of the harbor. The room was quiet and I slept like a baby. The beds and pillows were so comfortable. Our stay included breakfast each morning and what a treat. The staff was wonderful and the food marvelous - they had a great selection of fresh berries, yogurt, Danish, cereal etc. that you could help yourself too. They also offered an area where you could get eggs or omelets made to order, as well as pancakes or French toast (I did not eat at either one of these so I not sure if it was pancakes, French toast or both offered). The food was fresh and yummy. The only downside to our stay was that we did have to pay for parking. But even then I would still highly recommend the Hilton.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The dedicated staff, the waterfront location, the breakfast buffet that is a cut above, the separate buildings that add a charm...yes, stay here. Let them park your car and then stroll downtown.
reviews.title: When in St Augustine, stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: View the horse and buggies from your balcony. Let the gulls and pelicans sing their siren song. The boats and passing parade of this time honored waterfront are yours at this comfortable lodging.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel......

aka: Hilton St. Augustine Historic Bayfront Hotel
